Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Here at Mindera, we are continuously developing a fantastic team, and would love it for you to join us.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be a key member of the client's ML Platform team to scale

their ML capabilities to meet the needs of the team and company goals.

You will be joining in the early stages of our journey as we build out the team. We're migrating to Snowflake platform along with other tooling as part of the modern data stack such as AWS (Sagemaker). You will be responsible for designing and implementing the infrastructure and tools that enable the development and deployment of machine learning models. In this role, you will be using ground-breaking technology on the Snowflake platform to build and support world-class ML systems, both batch and real-time.

National and international expected traveling time varies according to project/client and organizational needs: 0%-15% estimated.You'll be joining our Data Products team, working closely with teams that are aligned to value

steams.

Requirements

What you'll be doing


Contribute to the design, development, and deployment of our ML platform
Define and implement best practices for training, evaluating, and deploying machine learning models at scale
Collaborate with software engineers, data engineers, and data scientists to develop end-to-end ML solutions
Extend and maintain our self-service platform to help our data science teams quickly



We're looking for someone with:


Educational Background in Computer Science
Hands-on experience in machine learning engineering, with a proven track record of designing and deploying large-scale machine learning systems
Extensive knowledge of software development with Python, SOLID principles
Vast Experience with SQL
Understanding of machine learning techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, MLOps, and data engineering
Solid Experience with Snowflake
Infrastructure as Code - Terraform (or similar)
Practical knowledge of AWS, GCP or Azure
Experience with or equivalent to: Vertex, Dataflow, Cloud Run, BigQuery, Datastore, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions and PubSub
Experience with or equivalent to: Snowflake Cortex / AWS Bedrock, AWS MSK, Snowpipe Streaming.



Benefits

The Things We Really Care About:


Health Insurance, because health comes first
Flexible working hours
Open holidays, take the time you need for yourself
Profit distribution for everyone
Mindera Annual Trip, Sports, and sharing groups to connect and have fun!
Training & conferences, create your own training plan
Child Care vouchers



Other Good Things:


Choose Laptop & Peripherals that best suit your needs
Hotspot with unlimited usage (PT), for work or Netflix ;)
We have amazing offices in Porto, Aveiro, and Coimbra if you want to physically connect with minders. Remote is also an option
At the offices, we have a wide range of snacks to keep you fed and healthy
Partnerships with local businesses


Most of all You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together in a politics-free environment. Our culture reflects our lean and self-organization attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication. Freedom and Responsibility go hand in hand, and we value commitment, feedback, and empathy.

About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their products and deliver high-performance, resilient and scalable software systems that create an impact in their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog and our Handbook!

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Aveiro, Portugal | Coimbra, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA | San Francisco, USA | Chennai, India | Bengaluru, India | Cluj-Napoca, Romania | Blumenau, Brazil

Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products

Description:
Do you get excited about working with a world team in an inspiring work environment?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > LaC Infrastructure

Through innovation, development, and continuous product improvement we develop the products and technologies that brings the highest possible value to our customers and to Vestas. Loads & Control (LaC) is responsible for designing and optimizing Vestas' products for optimal performance, loads and control strategies together with cross-product design work. The department consists of highly skilled, international, and well experienced engineers located across Portugal, Denmark, and India. In LaC Modelling & Infrastructure you will be taking full responsibility for developing SW solutions to enable simulation models for loads and power predictions which are efficient, scalable and with an adequate physical representation of Vestas WTG and Plant products. We have a sophisticated modelling environment that is closely interfaced with loads and control processes and activities and plays a vital role in overall product development and other value chain activities, as Vestas heavily relies on these to take critical business and product design decisions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Engineer with a polyglot programming background to join our creative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Python, MATLAB, and C#, with Delphi experience being a bonus. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, and familiarity with the Agile framework is essential. Experience in the wind domain, particularly in loads and control software development, and any cloud environment will be highly advantageous.

Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain software applications using Python, MATLAB, C#, and optionally Delphi.
Collaborate with global teams to design, implement, and optimize software solutions.
Work as an individual contributor on complex projects, taking full ownership of the software development lifecycle.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Integrate software solutions with cloud environments and ensure seamless deployment.
Utilize wind domain knowledge, especially in loads and control software development, to enhance application performance and functionality.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior engineers.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Continuously explore new technologies and frameworks to improve development processes and product quality.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
More than 2 years of professional software development experience.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and C#.
Experience with Delphi is advantageous.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience working in the wind domain is an added advantage.
Experience in loads and control software development is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work individually and as part of a global team.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Competencies

Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Knowledge of software design patterns and principles.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Experience in developing and deploying microservices.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimization techniques.

What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a global team in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. The working environment in Loads & Control is informal but with clear direction. You will have the freedom to develop innovative solutions and actively support the department in setting the direction and principles of its digital transformation. You will be offered an attractive compensation package based on your qualifications and the demands of this position.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

Five9 Shares
Bonus Scheme

Introduction Sentence

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Tech Hub in Portugal, you will be at the forefront of innovation at our company. Engage with stakeholders across various business units to integrate artificial intelligence as a pivotal support tool across our entire value chain, spanning from content processing to monetization. In this position, you will take on an important role within your Scrum team. Design and implement machine learning and deep learning techniques, that have a significant impact on ProSiebenSat.1's business

Design data processing pipelines and identify as well as implement automation use cases
Manage the development of serverless applications with tasks ranging from database management to data delivery
Elevate your expertise on state-of-the-art AI/ ML cloud platform and features such as infrastructure as a code, CI/ CD pipelines, event-driven/ serverless architecture and separate processing pipelines for ETL, model training and inference
Be an integral part of one of our experienced development teams and benefit from personalized support to foster your personal growth

University degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in information technology, computer science or a related technical field
First practical experience in machine learning such as classical machine learning, deep learning models (e.g., decision trees, CNN and LSTM) as well as relevant technical skills like Python programming (using PySpark, pandas, numpy), SQL or Bash scripting
Prior hands-on familiarity with databases (PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB) and **AWS**, as well as tools like FastAPI, GraphQL
Affinity for CI/CD and MLOps tools like Metaflow or MLflow
Proven ability to work effectively in an agile setup, collaborating with cross-functional teams
Fluent in English (Portuguese and/ or German language proficiency is a plus)

Become a part of a leading media company and help us to create real emotions among our viewers and customers
Join us in our transformation journey as we work to create a world-class technology hub

Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities
Join our P7S1 employee networks and get engaged in a topic you are passionate about, e.g., PROUD, Greenteam, fempowerment, language buddies
Make the best of our structured career path to support your personal development and growth
Hang out with the team at our amazing office space at LACS Porto

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.

You are looking for an exciting career opportunity in media and e-com, love to work for different branches and products, and become part of a diverse tech community? Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Description:
As an Embedded Developer you will design, develop, test and validate embedded software for lighting control systems.
Your remit will include but not limited to:
Design, develop, test, and validate embedded software for lighting control systems.
Implement control algorithms and manage software flow to ensure smooth control of lighting systems.
Work closely with hardware engineers to develop software that integrates seamlessly with lighting control hardware components.
Optimize existing embedded code for improved performance and energy efficiency.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to embedded software in both development and production phases.
Develop prototypes to validate design concepts and ensure functional alignment with product requirements.
Create comprehensive documentation of embedded code, including in-code comments, external documentation, and user manuals.
Implement rigorous testing protocols to ensure embedded software reliability, stability, and functionality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, frontend developers, and product managers to ensure coherent product development.
Ensure that embedded software adheres to relevant safety, quality, and industry standards.

Your profile

In order to fulfil your goals, you should have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field, and:
Proficiency in embedded C/C++ programming as well as Golang
Proven experience as a Wireless Engineer, preferably within a domain related to lighting control or smart home ecosystems, and in developing cloud-based systems. Certifications in wireless technologies, RF engineering, or related fields would be beneficial. Experience with IoT technologies, protocols, and cybersecurity.
Proficiency in wired & wireless communication protocols and technologies (e.g., DALI, DMX, KNX, Wi-Fi, Zigbee, BLE).
Experience with RF design, analysis, and testing.
Understanding of security protocols related to wireless communications.
Install, update, and manage software on Linux systems.
Experience in Linux system administration, e.g. Yocto.
Experience with agile and DevOps methodologies.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiar with optimizing software and applications to ensure compatibility and peak performance within Linux environments.
Ability to deliver results in a high-pace and customer demanding environment.
Ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
High result-orienting & performance culture in balance with empathic team spirit.

Title: Control Software Engineer
Description:
Do you get excited about working with a world team in an inspiring work environment?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > LaC Infrastructure

Through innovation, development, and continuous product improvement we develop the products and technologies that brings the highest possible value to our customers and to Vestas. Loads & Control (LaC) is responsible for designing and optimizing Vestas' products for optimal performance, loads and control strategies together with cross-product design work. The department consists of highly skilled, international, and well experienced engineers located across Portugal, Denmark, and India. In LaC Modelling & Infrastructure you will be taking full responsibility for developing SW solutions to enable simulation models for loads and power predictions which are efficient, scalable and with an adequate physical representation of Vestas WTG and Plant products. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Python, MATLAB, and C#, with Delphi experience being a bonus. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, and familiarity with the Agile framework is essential. Experience in the wind domain, particularly in loads and control software development, and any cloud environment will be highly advantageous.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with global teams to design, implement, and optimize software solutions.
Work as an individual contributor on complex projects, taking full ownership of the software development lifecycle.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Integrate software solutions with cloud environments and ensure seamless deployment.
Utilize wind domain knowledge, especially in loads and control software development, to enhance application performance and functionality.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior engineers.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Continuously explore new technologies and frameworks to improve development processes and product quality.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
More than 2 years of professional software development experience.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and C#.
Experience with Delphi is advantageous.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience working in the wind domain is an added advantage.
Experience in loads and control software development is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work individually and as part of a global team.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Competencies


Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Knowledge of software design patterns and principles.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Experience in developing and deploying microservices.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimization techniques.


What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a global team in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. The working environment in Loads & Control is informal but with clear direction. You will have the freedom to develop innovative solutions and actively support the department in setting the direction and principles of its digital transformation. You will be offered an attractive compensation package based on your qualifications and the demands of this position.

Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Description:
As an Embedded Developer you will design, develop, test and validate embedded software for lighting control systems.
Your remit will include but not limited to:
Design, develop, test, and validate embedded software for lighting control systems.
Implement control algorithms and manage software flow to ensure smooth control of lighting systems.
Work closely with hardware engineers to develop software that integrates seamlessly with lighting control hardware components.
Optimize existing embedded code for improved performance and energy efficiency.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to embedded software in both development and production phases.
Develop prototypes to validate design concepts and ensure functional alignment with product requirements.
Create comprehensive documentation of embedded code, including in-code comments, external documentation, and user manuals.
Implement rigorous testing protocols to ensure embedded software reliability, stability, and functionality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, frontend developers, and product managers to ensure coherent product development.
Ensure that embedded software adheres to relevant safety, quality, and industry standards.

Your profile

In order to fulfil your goals, you should have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field, and:
Proficiency in embedded C/C++ programming as well as Golang
Proven experience as a Wireless Engineer, preferably within a domain related to lighting control or smart home ecosystems, and in developing cloud-based systems. Certifications in wireless technologies, RF engineering, or related fields would be beneficial. Experience with IoT technologies, protocols, and cybersecurity.
Proficiency in wired & wireless communication protocols and technologies (e.g., DALI, DMX, KNX, Wi-Fi, Zigbee, BLE).
Experience with RF design, analysis, and testing.
Understanding of security protocols related to wireless communications.
Install, update, and manage software on Linux systems.
Experience in Linux system administration, e.g. Yocto.
Experience with agile and DevOps methodologies.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiar with optimizing software and applications to ensure compatibility and peak performance within Linux environments.
Ability to deliver results in a high-pace and customer demanding environment.
Ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
High result-orienting & performance culture in balance with empathic team spirit.

Title: Control Software Engineer
Description:
Do you get excited about working with a world team in an inspiring work environment?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > LaC Infrastructure

Through innovation, development, and continuous product improvement we develop the products and technologies that brings the highest possible value to our customers and to Vestas. Loads & Control (LaC) is responsible for designing and optimizing Vestas' products for optimal performance, loads and control strategies together with cross-product design work. The department consists of highly skilled, international, and well experienced engineers located across Portugal, Denmark, and India. In LaC Modelling & Infrastructure you will be taking full responsibility for developing SW solutions to enable simulation models for loads and power predictions which are efficient, scalable and with an adequate physical representation of Vestas WTG and Plant products. We have a sophisticated modelling environment that is closely interfaced with loads and control processes and activities and plays a vital role in overall product development and other value chain activities, as Vestas heavily relies on these to take critical business and product design decisions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Engineer with a polyglot programming background to join our creative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Python, MATLAB, and C#, with Delphi experience being a bonus. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, and familiarity with the Agile framework is essential. Experience in the wind domain, particularly in loads and control software development, and any cloud environment will be highly advantageous.

Responsibilities


Develop, test, and maintain software applications using Python, MATLAB, C#, and optionally Delphi.
Collaborate with global teams to design, implement, and optimize software solutions.
Work as an individual contributor on complex projects, taking full ownership of the software development lifecycle.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Integrate software solutions with cloud environments and ensure seamless deployment.
Utilize wind domain knowledge, especially in loads and control software development, to enhance application performance and functionality.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior engineers.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Continuously explore new technologies and frameworks to improve development processes and product quality.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
More than 2 years of professional software development experience.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and C#.
Experience with Delphi is advantageous.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience working in the wind domain is an added advantage.
Experience in loads and control software development is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work individually and as part of a global team.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Competencies


Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Knowledge of software design patterns and principles.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Experience in developing and deploying microservices.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimization techniques.


What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a global team in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. The working environment in Loads & Control is informal but with clear direction. You will have the freedom to develop innovative solutions and actively support the department in setting the direction and principles of its digital transformation. You will be offered an attractive compensation package based on your qualifications and the demands of this position.

Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
